question: In 1657, who turned down the opportunity to become King of England?
chain_of_thought_result: In 1657, Oliver Cromwell turned down the opportunity to become King of England. After the English Civil War and the execution of King Charles I, Cromwell became the leader of the Commonwealth of England. In 1657, there was a proposal to make him king, but he declined the title, preferring to maintain the republican government structure.
